title: Machine Learning and Racialized Difference Sensory Training: Historical Comparison and Participatory Inquiry

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of fundamental machine learning concepts, data analysis experience, and basic knowledge of racialized social structures
context.additional_context: For multicultural language data processing managers/leaders, strengthens awareness and improvement capabilities regarding racial biases in algorithms

learning_goals: Learners can explain at least three mechanisms by which vector-based classification in machine learning models reproduces racialized differences.
Write a comparative analysis report on similarities and differences between historical racial statistics (20th century) and modern vector-based data processing.
Design and demonstrate a language-processing prototype that incorporates strategies to minimize racial bias in team-based PBL assignments.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
